At the same time, it was Emperor Wen who, acting on the advice of his only Confucian minister, Jia Yi, began to reclaim the power ceded local authorities by the first emperor, Liu Bang. He did so by dividing up the fiefs of potential rivals. This policy would eventually culminate in the highly centralized rule of Emperor Wu. Emperor Wen also showed interest in the supernatural and techniques for attaining long life that would so preoccupy Emperor Wu

The 1982 constitution gives the power to interpret and enforce the constitution not to the judiciary but to the supreme legislature and its standing committee. Because the National People's Congress drafts and adopts laws in the first place, it is unlikely that that body would interpret any statute or amendment as inconsistent with the constitution or the basic principles of the statutes.
